summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from December 2018, with an embedded earlier email from March 2016. The 2018 emails discuss obtaining notes and records from a meeting with Peter Skinner regarding Jeffrey Epstein. The 2016 email from Skinner shares a news article about Epstein and introduces attorney Sigrid McCawley.

persons.name: Peter Skinner
persons.role: Email correspondent, likely legal or investigative contact
persons.context: He is the sender of the 2016 emails, sharing a news article about Jeffrey Epstein and introducing attorney Sigrid McCawley. In 2018, others are seeking notes from a meeting with him.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.context: Introduced by Peter Skinner in a 2016 email as one of the lead attorneys on a case related to Jeffrey Epstein, with knowledge of the facts.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in a 2016 news article shared by Peter Skinner about his continued relationships with young women, and is the subject of the legal case McCawley is working on.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as the defendant in a defamation case mentioned in an attached document list from a 2016 email.

persons.name: Judge Sweet
persons.context: Mentioned as having denied Ghislaine Maxwell's motion to dismiss in a defamation case on the date of a 2016 email.

connections.description: Skinner introduces McCawley in an email as a lead attorney on the case, indicating a working relationship.
McCawley is described as a lead attorney on a case related to Epstein, though the exact nature (representing victims vs. Epstein) is not specified.
Maxwell is a co-defendant or associate in the broader Epstein case context, as she is the subject of a related defamation lawsuit.
Skinner is sharing information and coordinating with attorneys about the Epstein case, indicating a professional interest.

events.title: PageSix article on Epstein
events.description: The New York Post's PageSix reports on Jeffrey Epstein's continued relationships with young women, specifically mentioning his East Side mansion housing 'Russian playmates'.

events.title: Meeting with Peter Skinner
events.description: A meeting occurs between Peter Skinner and an unnamed recipient(s), during which case documents are discussed and later attached in an email.

events.title: Judge Sweet denies Maxwell's motion
events.description: Judge Sweet denies Ghislaine Maxwell's motion to dismiss in a defamation case against her.

events.title: Request for meeting notes on Skinner/Epstein
events.description: A series of emails in December 2018 show a request for any notes and records from a prior meeting with Peter Skinner regarding Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: In March 2016, a PageSix article was circulated reporting on Jeffrey Epstein's continued relationships with young women.
Attorney Sigrid McCawley was introduced as a lead attorney on the Epstein-related case in February 2016.
A defamation case against Ghislaine Maxwell was active in February 2016, with a motion to dismiss being denied that same day.
In late 2018, there was an active effort to gather all notes and records from a 2016 meeting with Peter Skinner concerning Epstein.
The email correspondence indicates ongoing legal and investigative activity related to Epstein and his associates between 2016 and 2018.
